channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Seeing Greene: How to Avoid High Down Payments and When to BRRRR vs. Buy New
item.description: One of the biggest hurdles to rental property investing? High down payments. Most lenders want you to come to the table with twenty to thirty percent down, but with home […]

item.title: More neobanks are becoming mobile networks — and Nubank wants a piece of the action
item.description: Nubank is taking its first tentative steps into the mobile network realm, as the NYSE-traded Brazilian neobank rolls out an eSIM (embedded SIM) service for travelers. The service will give customers access to 10GB of free roaming internet in more than 40 countries without having to switch out their own existing physical SIM card or […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: A Legal Doctrine That Shields Police From Many Lawsuits May Be Losing Support
item.description: A federal judge in Mississippi joined other courts in recently rejecting police arguments that qualified immunity protected their actions.

item.title: Federal Experts Talk Bird Flu ‘What Ifs’ in WebMD Live Event
item.description: WebMD brought together experts from four federal agencies to talk prevention, monitoring, and what the “what ifs” of bird flu might look like.

item.title: Building Generational Wealth? Don’t Lose It with This ONE Critical Mistake
item.description: You’re working hard to build wealth, but without estate planning, your assets could easily land in the wrong hands, causing your family a great deal of trouble. No one likes […]

item.title: MARS doubles down on India’s Infra.Market with new $50M investment
item.description: Infra.Market, an Indian startup that helps construction and real estate firms procure materials, has raised $50M from MARS Unicorn Fund. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Out of the Blue: The Rise and Fall of a Black Cop
item.description: After Cleveland officer Vincent Montague shot a Black man, he got promoted. Then he allied with Black Lives Matter, and his life went off the rails.

item.title: What’s Next in Health Care for Older Adults: Questions and Answers With John Whyte, MD
item.description: As WebMD’s chief medical officer, John Whyte, MD, is in a unique position to see both the current state of medical care for America’s older adults and the way things are trending for the future. We asked him to share his insight on a few topics, along with a bit of advice.

item.title: How I Live Rent-Free and Car-Free: My Journey to Zero Housing and Transportation Costs
item.description: The two largest expenses for most households are housing and transportation. In fact, they account for over half of the average household budget. The BLS Survey of Consumer Expenditures found that in 2022, the average household […]

item.title: Cloover wants to speed solar adoption by helping installers finance new sales
item.description: Small operations can lose customers by not offering financing, something the Berlin-based startup wants to change. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The Marshall Project Wins Prestigious Robert F. Kennedy Journalism Award for Criminal Justice
item.description: The award recognizes our 2023 investigation exposing lax prison discipline for abusive guards in New York state prisons.

item.title: Get the Care You Need in a COVID-19 World
item.description: What to expect at the doctor’s office, hospitals, and long-term care facilities, the future of telemedicine, and how to get the best care during COVID-19.

item.title: A Massive Commercial to Residential Conversion is Taking Shape Nationwide—Here’s What Investors Should Know
item.description: From the boardroom to the bedroom, faced with empty offices as remote employment continues to starve cities of workers, a massive nationwide repurposing is underway to transform workplaces into residential […]

item.title: Adani looks to battle Reliance, Walmart in India’s e-commerce, payments race, report says
item.description: India's Adani Group is in discussions to venture into digital payments and e-commerce, according to a report. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Police Tactics at Some Pro-Palestine Protests Ignore Past Lessons
item.description: While some universities have sought peaceful approaches, others have used aggressive policing that bucks research from the protests following George Floyd’s murder.

item.title: Personal Shopper: A Savvy Black Entrepreneur Guides You to Eczema-Friendly Clothes, Creams, Cosmetics, and More
item.description: A savvy black entrepreneur guides you on an eczema-friendly shopping spree.

item.title: 9 Vital Questions to Ask When Vetting Your Real Estate Investing Team
item.description: Asking these questions will help you find team members who align with your investment goals.

item.title: Ledger starts shipping its high-end hardware crypto wallet
item.description: Ledger, a French startup mostly known for its secure crypto hardware wallets, has started shipping new wallets nearly 18 months after announcing the latest Ledger Stax devices. The updated wallet features an E-Ink display and has been designed in partnership with Tony Fadell, one of the main designers behind the iPod. E-Ink technology is generally […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Susan Chira to Step Down as The Marshall Project’s Editor-in-Chief in January
item.description: Under her stewardship, the news nonprofit more than doubled in size, opened local newsrooms and won its second Pulitzer Prize.

item.title: Behind the Spike in Colorectal Cancer Among Young Americans
item.description: Colorectal cancer cases increased a whopping 333% among 15- to 19-year-olds and 185% among 20- to 24-year-olds from 1999 to 2020.
